main event: Sightings of an unidentified aerial object over San Francisco, California on April 6, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as round, metallic in appearance, and approximately 30 to 40 feet in diameter.
The object made three passes over the area and was observed visually from the ground.
The object disappeared in the direction of the Oakland Bay Bridge.
The observation lasted for approximately 2 minutes.
The object was detected on ground radar, with its flight described as straight, from east to west, and a slow fall.
sighted object: Round, metallic object approximately 30-40 feet in diameter
